text: Bottle. Pours clear gold, white head. Aroma is grass, pine, grapefruit / citrus rind, grain. Flavor is pine, bitter citrus rind, dough, grain. Solid session.
Perfect beer for after a hike on July 4th weekend in Warren, VT. Light, yet full of flavor. Not much lacing but thats to be expected.

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle: The aroma consists of light-moderate tropical fruits, citrus, lemon, faint dank hops, and grapefruit. It pours a hazy dull orange with a small white head that fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin soapy ring. The flavor starts with light tropical fruits and mild citrus. The finish has light-moderate grapefruit, light pine, grass, and lemon peel. Its light bodied with light-moderate carbonation.
On tap at Prohibition Pig. Flavors are sweet cereals, resinous hops and pine needles with grassy and earthy notes. Light to medium body, moderate to good carbonation, smooth texture.

Bottle shared by Lunch. Thanks Paul.

Copper orange body with a half inch of head. Aromas include a bouquet of citrus and tropical fruits. Flavor is more of the same with pineapple, orange, mango, finishing with grapefruit zest. Citrus rind and lingering bitter finish. Thin body, but thats to be expected in a >4% session IPA. Refreshing and easy drinking. Good stuff.

22 oz bottle. Thanks Huhzubendah! Pours a clear light orange with pillowy spongy head that diminishes to uneven head. Aroma is citrus with grapefruit, pine, tropical fruit and light malt. Flavor is same, but generally understated. Bitter finish.

Pale straw color, slightly cloudy. Melons, floral, some grassy notes. Predominantly bitter, though well balanced. Medium body, quite clean, but fairly acidic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared in NY. Pours clear, honey-gold with a creamy white head. Grainy bread in the nose, some orange. Light sweet flavor, more grains, some bitter husks, orange citrus, light grass. Light bodied with fine to average carbonation. Finishes with further grainy husks, bread, orange rind. Decent overall. Pretty drinkable.

22oz bottle, from The Warren Store. Pours a hazy orange amber color with a white head and some lacing. Aroma is hoppy, mango, pine, pineapple, grass. Medium on the palate with big, creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, a touch of cereal, loads of pine and citrus hops, some grass, some pineapple, with a light, bitter finish. Not sure I believe that this beer is 3.8%, but either way, its very nice.
Bottle shared by Victor at Monday Night Tasting. Pours orange gold with white head. Nose/taste of grass, pine, grapefruit peel, light malt and toasted bread. Lighter/medium bodied.
Bottle. Hazy orange pour with white head. Grassy, earthy and pine aromas. Light citrus, earthy and pine flavors, very mild profile but not lacking.

Bottle. Pours murky orange with thick white head that lingers. Medium hop aroma like a lite DS with mild carbonation. Sweet and tart hop flavors with nutty finish. Rare complexity from a session ipa. A little thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle... Hazy golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. The earthy aroma is of funky armpit and green onion accompanied by a whisper of cat piss. Medium-bodied and dry with jazzy carbonation. Medium bitter and tasty. Finishes crisp, lightly bitter, and then dry. Should be named Simcoe Fever. Kudos to landhoney for popping the top on this one!

golden pour, fair sized head. Grapefruit/citrus zest in the aroma mostly. Cereal, Grains, lemongrass, lemon zest, grapefruit, extremely crisp. Lighter body. Extremely drinkable - I could kick this back all spring.

[5262-20130426] Tap. Puffed rice cereal aroma.Slightly hazy, light orange body with a medium-lasting creamy white head. More yeasty cereal grains in the flavour with a puff of lemon pip hops. Medium body. Nice bitter balance. (7/4/8/4/16) 3.9
(@ Black Back Pub, Waterbury, VT)

Sampled at SIPtemberfest. I like the idea of a session-style IPA, since that flavor profile tend to be one of my favorites. The only consequence of this approach is that the beer tastes a bit "thin" to me... but good!

In short: A aromatic citrusy hops fix at 3.5% abv!!! Thirst beer for the American hops lover.
How: Bottles 22oz, all consumed very fresh.
The look: Cloudy pale orange body topped by a medium white head with medium retention.
In long: The highly aromatic nose is bursting with citrusy hops (lots of lemons) as well as some flower petals. More aromatic hops in this baby than in most Double IPAs. Body has crisp crackery cereals, zero sweetness sensation, like some kind of crispy soda cracker. That backbone obviously makes the very bright hop bill shine. Lemon zest, white grapefruits, orange flesh, piney notes. Sharp bitterness of medium intensity. Extremely refreshing. Body is slender but never watery. This beer is crisper than crisp. Almost as good as their own Three Penny Especiale (a similar low-abv hoppy ale by Lawsons), although the fact that I had the Especiale on tap and Spring Fever from in bottle may have to do with me preferring the Especiale. Anyway, a wonderful lov abv hop fix. Loved that beer, Im glad I was able to have multiple Spring Fevers, maybe it is because of my weakened immune system, because of years of excessive drinking, Im no doctor.

22oz bottle from duchessedubourg.
Appearance : Clear pale yellow with small head.

Aroma : Big floral hops with light piny notes. Quite malty.

Taste : Malty with piny hops. Slightly resinous finish. Slightly oily and sticky hops. 

Palate : Average carbonation.

Overall : Interesting beer. Quite a lot of body. quite a lot of residual sweetness from the malt which is not a bad thing in such a light beer. Hop stickiness also adds some depth and some texture. Well balanced. Quite an interesting take at the low abv IPA.

bottle shared by fred82, thanks bro. pours hazy golden orange with a small white cap, some retention. spicy citrus, fresh leafiness, grainy character to the malt bill, also a caramel hint - minimal that is, never crossing THE limit that so many have crossed. bright to average carbonation, light body - never watery, surprisingly, short but assertive spicy-citrusy-herbal (just a tad bland) finish. quenching and nice on this humid day!

22oz bottle pours a hazy, dark orange with some clumpy, cloudy white head. Nose is spectacular, zesty lemon, chive, scallion, orange, flower pollen. Flavor is incredible, bright hoppiness, lemon, grapefruit, mango, orange, scallion, light malt. Medium bodied, bright, refreshing finish. Tons of flavor. I am stunned by how much they packed into a beer that is only 3.8%.

Bottle shared by GT. Light orange pour with a white head. Big grapefruit and pine nose. A touch of peach, floral hops, and some biscuit malt. Fairly dry. The flavor is quite dry and resinous. Pine, grapefruit peel, and floral hop flavors. Biscuit malt, a bit of cracker, and a bitter finish.

651mL gold foil thanks to parkingphi on BA. Pours a low haze golden with soapy white foam. Nose is bright yellow fruit, butterscotch, melon, cantaloupe. Taste is juicy, fresh melon, aggressive nut shell and melon rind bitterness. Soapy and bone dry finish. After more pours, the palate gets more and more quenching with fresh crackery pale malt, biscuit. Really impressive. Easily the best beer at our tasting.
Amazing IPA super light and easy to drink yet a nice amount of hops and deliciousness . Thanks GT2!

I poured a 22oz bottle into a tulip glass. There was no freshness date. I bought it from a friend who traveled to the brewery (thanks, Jon!). 

Appearance: Dark orange or amber hue, almost brown. Hazy but translucent. Massive carbonation visible. Forms an average sized, white, frothy head which retains and laces well.

Smell: Strong, wonderful aroma of citrus fruit juice, especially orange. Minor pine notes as well.

Taste: Ive often scoffed at the notion of a "session IPA" or even when someone describes an IPA as "sessionable." Hops tend to be cloying, and you usually need a strong enough body to balance it out. To simply throw a bunch of hops into a sub 4% ABV beer would probably taste like hoppy water. I dont know how, but Lawsons Finest Liquids managed to figure out how to brew a beer with a genuine IPA taste, but keep the body amazingly light at only 3.8% ABV.

The beer begins on the milder side, with a gentle taste of citrus juice flavors. Theres a sweetness as well, but its restrained and not cloying. Reminds me of orange sherbet ice cream or some hard candy suckers. Theres a constant dry bitterness as well, but its not too intense until the beer reaches the apex, at which point the hops really come alive. The orange citrus and candy flavors become even stronger on the finish. This is a really delicious beer. Id drink it often if I could.

Drinkability: If you were to drink this beer blind you could easily peg it for a bigger brew. Ive had other beers of a comparable recipe whose bodies were thinner than this. While Lawsons Finest Spring Fever Session IPA is not exactly as hearty as an imperial stout, its just a bit bigger than youd think. The mouthfeel is fairly intense with a strong carbonation presence. Its easy to drink as it goes down smoothly. At only 3.8% ABV, this is most definitely a session beer, but even better than that - its a versatile beer. I could see this standing up to a lot of food, but just enjoying it on its own is satisfying enough.
Excessivement croustillant, très floral avec une touche tropicale pour finir sur un ton sec. La bière de soif idéale.
Nice sessionable beer, not out of control with hops, but not anything too amazing.

22 oz. bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany), pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out notes of pine, a little floral notes, and some soft biscuity malt. Flavour definitely isnt as hoppy as a normal strength IPA, with bitter herbal hops notes, a little citrus rind, and biscuity malts in the back. Quite astringent without being all that hoppy. Balanced well-enough, though definitely skewed towards the hops. Very easy to drink, but not the most interesting. Decent.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a creamy medium white head...nice lacing.  Aroma is herbal with some citrus rind and grass.  flavor is herbal wit grass/spice and some skunky notes.  Mouthfeel is light and the finish is dry and herbal.
Bottle.  Clear yellow pour with a white head.  Light hoppy aromas.  Super light with mild grapefruit hop notes.  A little bland and watery with a below average mouthfeel and body.
On tap at Pro Pig with Max and Andy.  Pours a hazed amber with a thin white head. Soft musk and light hops.  Gentle, estery musk.  Crisp and musky, light citrus wheat.  Gentle bitterness.  Lovely.

Gold-foil-topped bomber from PUBR.  Pours turbid dark straw with 1-finger frothy white head.  Nose is florals, tropical fruit, resiny hops.  Tastes floral, pale malty, floral, somewhat dry, with mid-palate resiny notes and funky yeasty spicy notes.  Comes off like a drier, more floral. yeastier Flower Power.

22oz bottle from adamjackson. Poured a good looking hazed orange with a bright white piss foam head. Aroma of citrus, lemons, wet grass, grains. Body is medium overall with average to stronger carbonation and a grainy finish. Flavor is great, dry citrus rind, orange marmalade topped toast, hint of lemons. For the ABV this beer is simply outstanding.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2013 Bouteille 22oz. Blonde pale trouble. Nez subtil mais agréable de houblons au profil dagrumes. Bouche un peu mince, amertume légèrement citrique, un peu de grain et dherbe avec une finale sèche mais un peu acre. Il ny a pas assez de bières comme celle-ci à moins de 4% dalcool en Amérique du Nord...
On tap.  Really nice bitterness with pine dominating. Light and crushable.

Pours a hazy golden with white head and some lacing. Aroma is piney, grapefruits, orange peel.Tase is the same with crispy malts and a dry finish. Low body and medium carbonation. Awesome flavors for a low abv beer
Tap.   Notes of pleasant bitter resin.  Pine.  Earthy herbs.  Tasty.  Clean.  This beer rocks.

Dégustée en fût au Farmhouse Tap & Grill à Burlington, VT. De couleur dorée-orangée et voilée. Nez de houblon herbeux,  fruité (agrumes, notes dabricots et de fruits tropicaux), citrique et légèrement résineux, moyen de céréales fraîches avec des traces de pain et dépices (poivre). Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen aux notes croustillantes ainsi quune texture aux notes huileuses. Goût moyen-amer de houblon herbeux, citrique, moyennement fruité (agrumes, notes de fruits tropicaux) et aux notes résineuses (une amertume présente toute la gorgée) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de grains de céréales frais avec des notes de pain puis en finale lamertume de houblon se fait moyennement asséchante, plus herbeuse et résineuse. Post-goût long et légèrement sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux, citrique, moyennement résineux et fruité (zeste dagrumes) avec des notes de céréales.  (12 mai 2013)

22 oz. bomber from PhillyCraft. Thanks again Vin! This one pours very pale yellow from the bottle, but has a nice golden color in the glass. A very fizzy white head settles rather quickly. The nose has some nice  green onion and pine notes with a touch of grapefruit in the background. Nice, but not as explosive as the Drakes Alpha Session that I matched it up against side by side. They actually both had a very similar aroma, just this one was more subdued. The flavor is very dry and hoppy with big time onion and pine, firm bitterness and just a hint of lightly grainy malt. I cant help but think of bong water when I drink this. Very nice and sessionable for sure, but I would have liked some more fruity hops to balance out the hop character a bit.

Pours a nice light golden color with a two finger foam head. Aromas are nice bright citrus, grass and a bit of a light earthy straw backbone. The palate follows the nose with a bit less fruit... heavy carbonation scrubs the slightly thin body a bit harshly but considering the abv this beer is tasty and has some good sessionable flavors... six pack for $10 yes... single 22z for $8 maybe wouldnt buy again.

2013-04-26. Lightly hazy orange body with a nice Lacey white head. 3++ Aroma is pleasant, bit mild, but has pleasant hop profile with notes orange and citrus seeds. 7+ Flavour is similar, pithy bitter orange citrus hops. 7+ Average plus bodied palate, fairly carbonated. Nice, super quaffable. On tap at Blackback Pub, Waterbury

22oz bottle. another courtesy of tom shoutout on this one.  couldnt resist opening this one up as soon as i got this... bottles opens with a hiss yielding a semi hazy orange light cidery hue, allowing some light to pass through, and topped with a milky yet slighty full fluffy white head... aroma of fresh dank semi-bitter citrus notes throughout with a pale grain backbone that keeps things in check.  a light herbal resiny essence plays with the aforementioned. this one develops and becomes more assertive as it warms... flavors of light but firm herbal citrusy flavors throughout with backing layersof crackery semi-sweet malt that eventually gives way to lasting bitterness on the palate.  light body as expected, wouldnt say completely watery but a touch flabby, and followed up with an adequate degree of semi-lively carbonation.  a little more pine and resiny backend.  awesomely drinkable at such a low abv while still offering up assertive flavors and aroma.  nice.

On draft and in a bottle..this beer did not last long in VT. lemony appearance, looks soft with a nice white head. Nose is pretty decent with citrus and wheat. Taste is awesome. very nice hoppiness, thin body which youd expect in a 3.5% IPA. Delicious and I hope this becomes a yearly release. Earlier Rating: 4/23/2013 Total Score: 3.8Very special beer at Lawsons 5th anniversary party! Sean, rocking party!!! Poured from a cask I believed, an incredible session ale made even better... more pine needle, more cloves and a nice peppery finish.

Great crisp and clean beer on tap at Worthy Burger.  Tons of floral and citrus with a brightness that makes you want to drink tons of this.  Really tasty and another winner from Lawsons.Earlier Rating: 4/29/2013 Total Score: 3.7Great sessionable pale ale that was amped up.  Very floral and a bit piney with light fruitiness.  Drinks very easily obviously but still has a ton of hop flavor and biscuity malt backbone.

On tap @ Farmhouse Tap & Grill. Pours straw golden with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is lemony with grapefruit, pine, cereals and spicy hops. Taste is also really lemony with grapefruits, fresh cereals, pine and spicy hops. Medium body. Crisp, fresh. Very good session beer. Its not light by any mean, but its also extremely drinkable and refreshing. Would love to have this on a regular basis.

22oz bomber supplied by Nick... Thanks man! Pours a slightly hazy light yellow with a decent white head. Smell is oranges with a bit of grass and hay. Taste is wheat and orange with a great body that usually is harder to find in these session beers. Great drinkability... Could put back a few more.

Thanks Nick! Straw pour with a small white head. Beautiful spicy hop character with mandarin and stone fruit leads to fruit cocktail and and tropical fruit. Mild cereal like graininess with a dry finish. Outstanding.

on draft at the anny party, so when you take a 3.5% beer and dry hopp it to hell like a 11% beer, you have to be very carful not to "Stone" it and make it unbearable bitter. This is correctly done, way to completely crush it Sean. Cheers!Earlier Rating: 4/20/2013 Total Score: 4On draft at worthy burger, big hoppy flavor, high carbonation, light and refreshing

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 On cask at Prohibition Pig, this is one of the 2 new releases from Lawsons. Pours hazy, cloudy yellow gold with snow white head, small in size along with lacing. Aromas of juicy hops, pine, lemons, grapefruit. Flavor is the same with lots of dank hops, and pine. Good bit of malt too. Finishes a little corny/lagery but makes sense for the 3.5 percent.  Light to medium in body. This is almost a doub sunshine light, session on this session juice for days meh. Re-rate...tried a couple glasses of the doub dry hopped version for the beer lovers ball, even better then the regular with more dankness and tangerine, grapefruit hops coming thorugh. Excellent.
